definition: structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: "Our priority is the pets," Binder said.
sentences.chinese: “寵物是我們的頭等大事，”賓得說。

sentences.english: A; I've got a long-lens Pentax and a cassette recorder.
sentences.chinese: 我帶了一個長鏡頭賓得相機和一個收錄機。

sentences.english: Can a light meter on a Pentax manual camera get jammed?
sentences.chinese: 賓得手動相機的測光表會壞嗎？

sentences.english: I don't agree, I think Pentax philosophy is strinkingly similar to SAAB.
sentences.chinese: 我不同意，我覺得賓得哲學類似薩伯。

sentences.english: We would like to express our heartfelt appreciation for your patronage of PENTAX products.
sentences.chinese: 我們謹表示衷心的感謝您的惠顧賓得的產品。

definition: body of a vehicle or machine/fuselage of a plane
Kodak (brand, US film company)/full name Eastman Kodak Company 伊士曼柯達公司|伊士曼柯达公司[Yi1 shi4 man4 Ke1 da2 Gong1 si1]
(coll.) sb new to a particular subject/rookie/beginner/newbie
chicken ribs/sth of little value or interest/sth of dubious worth that one is reluctant to give up/to be physically weak
film/roll of film/also written 膠捲|胶卷
